intro: Monanthos, commonly known as the single-flower plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its solitary, showy flower heads that often resemble daisies or sunflowers. The plants typically have narrow, grass-like leaves and are found in various habitats across the Northern Hemisphere. Monanthos species are often used in gardens for their ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators. They are generally easy to grow and thrive in well-drained soil and full sun.
